name: French Onion Soup
ingredients: 1 – Baguette, sliced 1/2 inch thick or sourdough buns
instructions: Peel and thinly slice onions, separate slices into rings
In Dutch oven, melt butter over medium heat
Increase temperature to high heat and add onions, stirring frequently until they appear almost burnt (quite brown with the odd black bit)
Reduce heat to low and add garlic, saute until garlic is soft; don’t allow garlic to brown
Add 10 cups of hot water, with beef bouillon and return to a boil, reduce to a simmer, leave uncovered until reduced by half, ~5-7 hours
In a medium skilled make a brown roux with the flour and remaining butter (https://toleiko.ca/recipes/recipe.html?recipe=roux).
Add a couple tablespoons of the hot stock to the roux, stirring constantly
Add this to the stock pot and stir constantly, let boil for ~5 minutes until slightly thicker and to eliminate the taste of raw flour

Serving: either in 4 onion-soup bowls, place a couple tablespoons of shredded cheese or in sourdough buns, cut out the center to make a bowl then place a couple tablespoons of shredded cheese in the makeshift bowl
Ladle soup to within 1/2 inch of the top of each bowl
cover soup with toasted baguette slices and add a bit more cheese (ensure the baguette and cheese don’t sink)
Place under broiler until cheese is melted and starting to brown

additional_context.story: Isaac made this very early on for Tori when they first started dating. At the time Tori was vegetarian and Isaac adapted the recipe to be vegetarian for her. They then stayed up until 3 or 4 in the morning talking to each other over bowls of this soup.
additional_context.tips: The longer the onions cook, the better!
